creditline: Given in memory of Jane and Colebert Andrus
markings: P.C. Lu & Sons, Ltd. sticker on underside | black marker, on underside: 339
text: Known as xianwenping (‘Vase decorated with bow-strings’), the compressed globular body of this vase is surmounted by a tall cylindrical neck and upturned rim. The shape of xianwenping were inspired by ancient bronze hu vessels of the Han dynasty. This example is striking for its flambé-glaze: the vase is coated with a brilliant blue-colored glaze accented with milky lavender-blue streaks.
title: Bottle vase (xianwen ping)
